body:
Comment 10: 
You're right, gomake is a bash script, and can't be executed on Windows. So, really,
we're looking for bash.exe instead. I'm pretty sure the error message is changed now:

C:\Documents and Settings\brainman>8g -V
8g version weekly.2011-05-22 8604+

C:\Documents and Settings\brainman>goinstall tideland-cgl.googlecode.com/hg
bash: === cd c:\MinGW\go\src\pkg\tideland-cgl.googlecode.com\hg; bash gomake -f- install
--- command "bash" not found in $PATH
goinstall: installing: running bash: command "bash" not found in $PATH

If you update your go source to the very latest (hg up), you should see message similar
to mine.

As to your original problem, you have to make sure you can execute gomake, therefore you
need bash.exe in your PATH. If you run your command from mingw command prompt, it should
work just fine. If you run your command from Winodws command prompt, you have to adjust
your PATH accordingly.

Alex
